issues.description: The signature of messageOnMilk() in the solution (and its interface) takes a double parameter, but the problem statement’s UML and task descriptions specify messageOnMilk() with no arguments. This parameter mismatch would block students from implementing the intended interface and tests.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the signature across artifacts by removing the volume parameter: define messageOnMilk():String in the Milkable interface and override it in Goat and Seal without parameters.

issues.description: The problem statement and UML diagram specify the Milkable interface method as messageOnMilk() with no parameters, but the solution’s Milkable interface (and its overrides in Goat and Seal) declare messageOnMilk(double volume). This mismatch in method signature will confuse students about which method to implement.
issues.suggested_fix: Either update the solution and interfaces to use a parameterless messageOnMilk() returning a String, as described in the problem statement, or adjust the problem specification and UML to include the volume parameter in messageOnMilk(double volume).
